title: Bartolomeo Ignazio Capello
text:
Bartolomeo Ignazio Capello (Borgo di <a href="Sugana%20Valley">Valsugana</a>, <a href="Trento">Trento</a>, Italy, 1689 - 1768) was an <a href="Italian%20people">Italian</a> painter in a late <a href="Baroque%20art">Baroque</a> style.
Biography.
He studied in <a href="Venice">Venice</a> under <a href="Gregorio%20Lazzarini">Gregorio Lazzarini</a> and <a href="Antonio%20Balestra">Antonio Balestra</a>; then traveled to <a href="Modena">Modena</a> where he created copies of the work of <a href="Correggio">Correggio</a>. He was employed to paint for the Court of the <a href="Elector%20of%20Mainz">Elector of Mainz</a>; and in the <a href="Villa%20Giovanelli%20Colonna">Villa Giovanelli Colonna</a> in <a href="Noventa%20Padovana">Noventa Padovana</a>, in Trento near Prato and Saracini; for the residence of <a href="Damian%20Hugo%20Philipp%20von%20Sch%C3%B6nborn">Cardinal Schönborn</a> in <a href="Speyer">Speyer</a>, and also for patrons in <a href="Salzburg">Salzburg</a>.
